content.raw:
Using cloudsim-prerelease-1.3.5 with Chrome, I was following [this tutorial](http://gazebosim.org/wiki/Tutorials/CloudSim/1.3/start_simulation) and experienced the following sequence of events:

* go to console page
* select "simulator" and press "Launch"; then press "OK"
* nothing seemed to change on the console page (i.e., no machine/constellation added to the Constellations widget)
* open new tab to the same URL, and can see the new machine/constellation starting up as expected
* go back to original tab and notice the presence of an unexpected form titled "Simulation properties, with some text boxes ("ROS Package," "Launch file," etc.)

I believe that the unexpected form was present before I clicked "Launch," but I'm not certain.

Going into the Chrome debugger on the page with the unexpected form, I see this error:

    Uncaught TypeError: Object [object Object] has no method 'dialog' constellations.js:59

Looks like a try/catch needs to be added somewhere.  Perhaps it's a race condition of some sort.
content.html:
Using cloudsim-prerelease-1.3.5 with Chrome, I was following this tutorial and experienced the following sequence of events:

  • go to console page
  • select "simulator" and press "Launch"; then press "OK"
  • nothing seemed to change on the console page (i.e., no machine/constellation added to the Constellations widget)
  • open new tab to the same URL, and can see the new machine/constellation starting up as expected
  • go back to original tab and notice the presence of an unexpected form titled "Simulation properties, with some text boxes ("ROS Package," "Launch file," etc.)

I believe that the unexpected form was present before I clicked "Launch," but I'm not certain.

Going into the Chrome debugger on the page with the unexpected form, I see this error:

Uncaught TypeError: Object [object Object] has no method 'dialog' constellations.js:59

Looks like a try/catch needs to be added somewhere. Perhaps it's a race condition of some sort.
